verses.text: Therefore, you shall love the LORD your God and keep his charge, his statutes, his rules, and his commandments always.
verses.comment: Stays close to the Hebrew structure. 'Charge' renders Hebrew 'mishmeret.'

verses.text: And know today that I am not speaking to your children who have not known or seen the discipline of the LORD your God—his greatness, his mighty hand, and his outstretched arm—
verses.comment: 'Discipline' translates 'musar.' The structure follows the original for clarity.

verses.text: his signs and his deeds that he did in Egypt to Pharaoh king of Egypt and to all his land,
verses.comment: Faithful to the original grammatical structure.

verses.text: and what he did to the army of Egypt, to their horses and to their chariots, how he made the water of the Red Sea flow over them as they pursued after you, and how the LORD destroyed them to this day,
verses.comment: 'Red Sea' for Hebrew 'Yam Suph.' Preserved original tense.

verses.text: and what he did to you in the wilderness, until you came to this place,
verses.comment: Structure closely matches the Hebrew phrasing.

verses.text: and what he did to Dathan and Abiram, the sons of Eliab, the son of Reuben, how the earth opened its mouth and swallowed them up, along with their households, their tents, and every living thing that followed them, in the midst of all Israel.
verses.comment: 'Followed them' renders 'that was at their feet.' Faithful representation.

verses.text: For your eyes have seen all the great work of the LORD which he did.
verses.comment: 'Great work' retains original Hebrew idiom.

verses.text: Therefore, you shall keep all the commandments which I command you today, so that you may be strong and go in and take possession of the land to which you are going over to possess,
verses.comment: Translated 'possess' for Hebrew 'yarash.'

verses.text: and so that you may live long in the land that the LORD swore to your fathers to give to them and to their offspring, a land flowing with milk and honey.
verses.comment: 'Flowing with milk and honey' kept as a literal rendering.

verses.text: For the land that you are going in to possess is not like the land of Egypt, from which you have come, where you sowed your seed and watered it by foot, as a garden of vegetables.
verses.comment: 'Watered it by foot' is a literal translation of the Hebrew idiom for irrigation.

verses.text: But the land that you are crossing over to possess is a land of hills and valleys, which drinks water from the rain of heaven,
verses.comment: Maintains Hebrew imagery of the land's fertility.

verses.text: a land that the LORD your God cares for. The eyes of the LORD your God are always upon it, from the beginning of the year to the end of the year.
verses.comment: 'Cares for' is a direct translation of the Hebrew.

verses.text: And if you will indeed obey my commandments which I command you today, to love the LORD your God and to serve him with all your heart and with all your soul,
verses.comment: 'Heart' and 'soul' retained from Hebrew 'levav' and 'nefesh.'

verses.text: then I will give the rain of your land in its season, the early rain and the latter rain, so that you may gather in your grain and your wine and your oil.
verses.comment: 'Early rain' and 'latter rain' are literal renderings of Hebrew 'yoreh' and 'malkosh.'

verses.text: And I will give grass in your fields for your cattle, and you shall eat and be full.
verses.comment: 'Be full' is literal for 'sated.'

verses.text: Take care lest your heart be deceived, and you turn aside and serve other gods and bow down to them.
verses.comment: 'Be deceived' preserves Hebrew nuance.

verses.text: Then the anger of the LORD will be kindled against you, and he will shut up the heavens, so that there will be no rain, and the land will yield no fruit, and you will perish quickly off the good land that the LORD is giving you.
verses.comment: 'Kindled' is literal from 'charah'; 'shut up the heavens' is a close translation.

verses.text: You shall therefore lay up these words of mine in your heart and in your soul. You shall bind them as a sign on your hand, and they shall be as frontlets between your eyes.
verses.comment: 'Frontlets' is a direct rendering referring to phylacteries.

verses.text: And you shall teach them to your children, talking of them when you are sitting in your house, and when you are walking on the way, when you lie down, and when you rise up.
verses.comment: Closely mirrors Hebrew hexameter structure.

verses.text: And you shall write them on the doorposts of your house and on your gates,
verses.comment: 'Doorposts' is literal (Heb. mezuzot).

verses.text: that your days and the days of your children may be multiplied in the land that the LORD swore to your fathers to give to them, as the days of the heavens above the earth.
verses.comment: 'As the days of the heavens above the earth' follows the Hebrew idiom.

verses.text: For if you will carefully keep all this commandment that I command you to do, loving the LORD your God, walking in all his ways, and holding fast to him,
verses.comment: 'Holding fast' renders Hebrew 'dabaq.'

verses.text: then the LORD will drive out all these nations before you, and you will dispossess nations greater and mightier than you.
verses.comment: Follows the original verb structure.

verses.text: Every place on which the sole of your foot treads shall be yours. From the wilderness and Lebanon, from the river, the river Euphrates, to the western sea, shall be your territory.
verses.comment: 'Western sea' is the literal Hebrew term for the Mediterranean.

verses.text: No man shall be able to stand before you. The LORD your God will lay the fear and the dread of you upon all the land that you shall tread, as he promised you.
verses.comment: 'Fear and dread' are literal translations of 'pachad' and 'yirah.'

verses.text: See, I am setting before you today a blessing and a curse:
verses.comment: Direct rendering with minimal interpretation.

verses.text: the blessing, if you obey the commandments of the LORD your God, which I command you today,
verses.comment: Structurally mirrors the Hebrew for clarity.

verses.text: and the curse, if you do not obey the commandments of the LORD your God, but turn aside from the way that I command you today, to go after other gods that you have not known.
verses.comment: Follows the parallel Hebrew clauses.

verses.text: And when the LORD your God brings you into the land that you are entering to possess, you shall set the blessing on Mount Gerizim and the curse on Mount Ebal.
verses.comment: Mount names transliterated directly from Hebrew.

verses.text: Are they not beyond the Jordan, west of the road, toward the setting sun, in the land of the Canaanites who live in the Arabah, opposite Gilgal, beside the oaks of Moreh?
verses.comment: 'Arabah' and 'oaks of Moreh' are kept as Hebrew terms for accuracy.

verses.text: For you are to cross over the Jordan to go in to possess the land that the LORD your God is giving you. And you shall possess it and dwell in it.
verses.comment: 'Possess' and 'dwell' are literal translations.

verses.text: And you shall be careful to do all the statutes and the rules that I am setting before you today.
verses.comment: Faithfully translates all original command words.
